comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: Helen Peters on the left, is pictured with Ethel Booth at the Brisbane General Hospital. Ethel Booth’s family moved to a farm between Woombye and Nambour in 1919. In 1930 she began her nursing training in Brisbane. She worked in nursing up until her retirement from Selangor Hospital in 1971. (Information taken from: www.sunshinecoast.qld.gov.au/library/sitePage.cfm?code=or...) The first nurses graduated from the General Hospital in 1888. Since that time, the hospital has provided training for thousands of doctors, nurses and allied health professionals. The General Hospital was renamed the Royal Brisbane Hospital in 1966 and has become the major teaching hospital for Queensland. (Information taken from: www.health.qld.gov.au/rbwh/history.asp

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: May 12 was the anniversary of Florence Nightingale's birth. She was one of the most influential nurses and transformed the profession. Are there any photos of nurses in your family collections?
